intro: Cardamine gouldii, commonly known as Gould's buttercup, is a small herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features delicate, palmately divided leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
